page.title: 18CUSTOMS
page.content: A number of old customs have died out. Hogmany used to be the night for Santa Claus for some lucky children.Now all youngsters are visited on the night before Christmas."First-footing" by a dark man is still practised as the New Year starts, but few carry a lump of coal or peat.(It is now more likely to be a bottle of whisky). Burn's suppers are a very common feature of January. April Gowk day is now the universal April Fools' Day.Hallowe'en is still kept with fancy-dress parties and guizing (children dressing up and carrying turnip lanterns)from house to house and providing a short entertain- ment in return for a small present. Guy Fawkes is the same as elsewhere. Birthdays call for "dookin" the birthday child (wetting or splashing) and "ruggin"(tugging )the hair the same amount of times as years.
